author: nc1234
content: Interesting. I encounter several tests in `transition` where when calculating proposer index, some of the slots don't have a proposer index because this condition's never met: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/00b74686e21af62e6498ee900f942f6f6689e294/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md?plain=1#L450 . author: m.kalinin
content: even if this loop is several iterations over the entire validator set it should find the solution eventually

author: nc1234
content: I see. That's the problem. Lodestar iterates the entire validator set only once to prevent an infinite loop. The tests passed when I allow it to iterate twice. Interesting that spec test previously didn't require us to loop more than once.

author: m.kalinin
content: With the previous spec the same validator balances were at the MaxEB which has changed since eip7251, i think it is important to test all clients with the increased MaxEB and not increased validator balances. The spec lacks tests where validator balances are below the MaxEB, before the MaxEB increase it was the edge case but now it becomes a common situation. I guess lodestar would fail to compute proposer index in the network where validators' EB is around 17 ETH and the set is small enough to make the loop iterate more than one time over the entire set
